title: Australian Type 2 Diabetes Risk (AUSDRISK) Assessment Tool
description: Estimates 5-year risk of developing type 2 diabetes in Australian patients based on demographic, lifestyle and simple anthropometric measures

parameters.name: parental_diabetes
parameters.description: Family history of diabetes in parents

parameters.name: high_blood_glucose_history
parameters.description: History of high blood glucose levels (e.g., during pregnancy, illness, or health check)

parameters.name: antihypertensive_medication
parameters.description: Currently taking medication for high blood pressure

parameters.name: current_smoker
parameters.description: Currently smoking cigarettes or other tobacco products on a daily basis

parameters.name: physical_activity
parameters.description: Physical activity status - Active if ≥150 minutes/week of walking (continuous ≥10 min) or moderate/vigorous activity

parameters.name: waist_circumference_category
parameters.description: Waist circumference category based on ethnicity and sex-specific cut-points

result.name: ausdrisk_score
result.description: AUSDRISK score for 5-year diabetes risk (0-35 points)

ranges.interpretation: Approximately 1 in 100 chance of developing type 2 diabetes within 5 years. Consider lifestyle modifications to maintain low risk.
Approximately 1 in 50 chance of developing type 2 diabetes within 5 years. Lifestyle modifications strongly recommended.
Approximately 1 in 30 chance of developing type 2 diabetes within 5 years. Lifestyle modifications strongly recommended, consider consulting healthcare provider.
Approximately 1 in 14 chance of developing type 2 diabetes within 5 years. See your doctor about your risk of diabetes and consider blood glucose testing.
Approximately 1 in 7 chance of developing type 2 diabetes within 5 years. See your doctor about your risk of diabetes. Blood glucose testing strongly recommended.
Approximately 1 in 3 chance of developing type 2 diabetes within 5 years. See your doctor about your risk of diabetes as soon as possible. You may already have diabetes.

references: Chen L, Magliano DJ, Balkau B, Colagiuri S, Zimmet PZ, Tonkin AM, et al. AUSDRISK: an Australian Type 2 Diabetes Risk Assessment Tool based on demographic, lifestyle and simple anthropometric measures. Med J Aust. 2010;192(4):197-202.
formula: Score = Age points + Sex points + Ethnicity points + Parental diabetes points + High blood glucose history points + Antihypertensive medication points + Smoking points + Physical inactivity points + Waist circumference points
notes: Waist circumference categories are ethnicity and sex-specific. For Aboriginal/Torres Strait Islander or Asian: Category 1 = <90cm (men), <80cm (women); Category 2 = 90-99cm (men), 80-89cm (women); Category 3 = ≥100cm (men), ≥90cm (women). For other ethnicities: Category 1 = <102cm (men), <88cm (women); Category 2 = 102-109cm (men), 88-99cm (women); Category 3 = ≥110cm (men), ≥100cm (women).
Physical inactivity is defined as less than 150 minutes per week of walking (if continuous and ≥10 minutes) or moderate/vigorous activity.
A score of 12 or higher indicates increased diabetes risk requiring medical evaluation.
The tool has 74% sensitivity and 67.7% specificity at the ≥12 point threshold.
